April 27, 1967
Honorable Milton Young
United States Senate
Washington, D. C.
Dear Senator Young:
I should like to express to you my own personal gratitude and that
of my faculty and our students for what has already been done to
further and promote the cause of new Social Work Manpower and
Training legislation, especially through Senate 1150.
As dean of a college which includes a fine Department of Social Work,
I have come to be increasingly aware of the great need for competent,
highly trained, and broadly educated social workers. I have also,
of course, become increasingly sensitive to the growing gap between
the need and the available financial resources for support of the
education of social workers.
May I respectfully ask you to accept our support and thanks for any
further contributions you may be able to make in this important
matter?
Yours sincerely.
Bernard O'Kelly
Dean
